New Records: Bas de Leede's figures of 2 for 115 in ten overs against Australia is now the most expensive ten-over spell in ODIs, relieving Mick Lewis of this unwanted record after 17 years.
Key Match Events: Taskin Ahmed was caught by de Leede off van Meekeren for 11 runs.
Mahmudullah scored a century in the previous match against South Africa.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh wary of Netherlands threat as World Cup comes to Kolkata.
Both teams enter this contest following massive defeats, looking to rise off the lower regions of the table.
Bangladesh can expect a fair bit of support at Eden Gardens with at least 2000 fans traveling from Dhaka and other parts of Bangladesh.
Bangladesh come to Kolkata following a 149-run defeat against South Africa in Mumbai.
Netherlands' inspiring performances issue a warning despite their 309-run defeat against Australia.
Scott Edwards leads the Netherlands team, which fought their way into this World Cup with a superb showing in the Qualifiers in Zimbabwe.
Bangladesh's selectors and team management seemed to have moved on from Mahmudullah this March, but he was brought back for the ODI series against New Zealand just before the World Cup.
Logan van Beek picked up four wickets against Australia despite a high economy rate.
Taskin Ahmed, who was sidelined by a shoulder niggle, bowled at full tilt two days before the match, so expect him to be back.
Towhid Hridoy could also return to the side after Bangladesh's experiment of playing six bowlers didn't work out against South Africa.
Max O'Dowd has a highest score of only 18 in five innings this World Cup, but Netherlands are likely to continue to back him.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Eden Gardens has hosted just a single ODI in the last six years, and though the pitches there historically tend to be batting-friendly, Sri Lanka were bowled out for 215 by India in that ODI this January.
The weather in Kolkata is expected to be hot and humid, with winter setting in only towards the middle or end of November.
Bangladesh and Netherlands have met in an ODI only twice so far, with the last meeting during the 2011 World Cup.
All of Mahmudullah's ODI centuries have come in ICC tournaments: three in the World Cup, and one in the Champions Trophy.
Others: Taskin Ahmed makes it known that Bangladesh are not done yet, stating that if they can win their remaining four games, anything can happen.
